block.p: Betsy Kelly Wilkowski and Keith Levenson were married last evening at Crabtree's Kittle House, a restaurant and inn in Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. Michael E. Thomas, a National Baptist minister, officiated.
Mrs. Levenson, 47, has her own graphic design firm in Yonkers. She is a graduate of Cooper Union.

Betsy Kelly Wilkowski and Keith Levenson were married last evening at Crabtreeâ€™s Kittle House, a restaurant and inn in Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. Michael E. Thomas, a National Baptist minister, officiated.

Betsy Kelly Wilkowski and Keith Levenson were married last evening at Crabtree's Kittle House, a restaurant and inn in Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. Michael E. Thomas, a National Baptist minister, officiated.
Mrs. Levenson, 47, has her own graphic design firm in Yonkers. She is a graduate of Cooper Union.

She is the daughter of Joyce and Eugene Kelly of Bronxville, N.Y. Her father retired as a vice president for municipal bond sales at Smith Barney in Manhattan. Her mother is a sales agent with Bronxville-Ley Real Estate.

Mr. Levenson, also 47, is a musical director who has worked on Broadway and national touring productions, including ''Annie,'' ''Grease'' and ''Dreamgirls.'' He is also a composer of musicals and an arranger, and a vice president for business development at Notion Music, a music software company in Greensboro, N.C.

He is a son of Elaine Berk of Manhattan and Robert Levenson of East Hampton, N.Y. His mother is the global account director for Perception Research Services, a marketing research company in Fort Lee, N.J., that specializes in packaging. His father retired as the vice chairman of Scali, McCabe, Sloves, the former advertising agency in New York. The bridegroom is a stepson of Kathe Levenson and of Mac Berk.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's two previous marriages.
